title: Most Hated Champion Help Thread
body:
I notice that 1/2 of the threads on here are "X champ is OP", "X champ is annoying", "Anyone else having trouble with {{champion:5}}?" (This one is what inspired me to make this thread). 

Simple idea of this thread. People post what champions that they're having trouble with and people who play them say either what gives them trouble, or what they would do to counter them. This thread can be used to reduce clutter on the G+B boards, and just people having trouble with champs in general. 

(I kinda hope this thread takes off, but if not, c'est la vi)

(Champions or item builds work, but preferably item builds since not everybody can afford 6300/975 for a new champ)

(Please check if the champ you came in here for has already been asked about.)

replies.body: I think this started as a good idea but turned into a dumping ground for people to bash champs...
Yeah, I kinda thought that that might happen but eh, long as it gets people talking then I don't mind at all.
{{champion:157}} Fuck. You. Like seriously I can only beat him with Azir. This is some bull shit.

People will swear to god that Yasuo is balanced.

You know something is fishy when just their primary passive is longer than Kalista's.
he is balanced, lol. he's weak until 3+ items

Yasuo is such an overloaded champion, his passive is literally a paragraph or two. Every single ability of his with the exception of his wind wall has so much loaded into It, It's insane.

His passive is actually 3 different passives, let alone how overloaded his Q, E, and Ult are.

Yeah, he's not balanced and VERY poorly designed. Sure he can be crazy fun, but that's like saying if I gave a champion every single thing in the game and 50,000 passives that he wouldn't be a fun champion. Of course someone so overloaded is going to be fun, just look at Ekko.

Yasuo is really unhealthy, poorly designed (like the rest of CertainlyT's champions), and unbalanced.

To argue with this, I'm going to bring up the creator of Yasuo, CertainlyT. Pretty much every single champion he has made has had colossal flaws and almost all of them were game breaking.

{{champion:122}} being reworked since his laning phase/dueling is probably one of the strongest in the game, but he's trash in teamfights and gets killed instantly. Was pretty game breaking, does every type of damage, and can be toxic since most cases if you get pulled and aren't a tank, you get blown up instantly. He's kiteable, but if you can't kite him in duels you pretty much always die.
{{champion:412}} overloaded and after nerfs, still the most popular support in the game
{{champion:429}} overloaded with everything but a heal. not as overpowered after being nerfed significantly but still one of the best champions in the game due to her passive, rend, and ultimate
{{champion:143}} had a 63%+ winrate and was so overpowered she had to be nerfed almost immediately after being released multiple times and now is one of the least played champions in the game

CertainlyT has extremely bad design flaws, and judging from his past of making overloaded champions, It's not hard to believe Yasuo is unbalanced.
rengar has 3 components to his passive, does that mean he's bad design and unhealthy?

I'm not quite sure, he's a weird champion.

If he gets fed, he'll keep even Annie in check on what "0 counterplay" really means. But if he gets behind, he's pretty useless aside from his CC.

I wouldn't say he's unhealthy, but I haven't played the champion and I don't see him a ton so I don't have room to say he's a bad design or not.
Why does everyone always include Zyra in these lists?

Imagine Zyra with more damage on like, everything I think, lower cooldowns, a free 20% CDR, and basically if you picked her you instantly won the game. 63% or higher winrate in just the first two days of her release.

So, your point as that a champion who was released numerically overpowered is the same as one who was has an overloaded kit with a tool for every situation, and whose only weaknesses can be negated by their own skillset?

{{champion:84}} _Hello. My name is Akali. People seem to have forgotten I exist since I was nerfed in 5.2._

I believe Akali is actually really strong against Yasuo. Here is how I use Akali to beat Yasou.

1. Start boots + 4 pots. You need the MS to help dodge is tornado, at least, if you are on the east coast like I am.
2. You first item is {{item:3145}}.
3. If he is competent, you next item is going to be {{item:1029}} . If not, then you want upgraded boots. I usually go with {{item:3020}}. These will help you position better for setting up your harass (wind wall is a pain).
4. Finish {{item:3146}}  and build as the battle unfolds; if you are primarily dealing with Yas, I recommend {{item:3157}} as your next big ticket item as Yas will probably be your problem the entire match.

Now, how do you use your kit . There are a two things to accept as fact (and they will make you play better as you won't stress them):

1. You will not out farm most Yas players early game. Farm as best you can, but you don't need to out CS him to beat him. If you are getting about 70-80% of his CS you will do alright early. You will make it up later (and make sure you do, you need that gold to stay relevant as Akali relies on raw numbers to stay relevant).

2. Do not try to kill Yas. This may sound counter intuitive, but you will get more kills not trying to kill him. Trying to kill him will get you killed. If he wants to run away, let him. Do not get baited into a tornado/ult combo. Make him play your game (which is a balance of patience and aggression... fitting for her character now that I think about it).

Akali's basic Anti-Yas strategy is as follows:

1. Watch him. When he gets his tornado proc, bait it and dodge it. Do not go in on him until he has burned it (I would go so far as to say wait for him to get it, bait, dodge, engage, so you don't have to worry about him getting it during a trade).
2. Akali's best opener (Q [wait] R AA Q AA) is the perfect combo for Yas. Your first Q will proc his shield, which will fall off before you want to AA (or R-AA) anyway. Q doesn't hit as hard as its proc, so this ends up being pretty big advantage for Akali.
3. Yas will be forced to choose to block a Q or your R. If you find he is saving it for your R, bait the wall with an R immediately after Q. This way, you can reposition and R-AA the Q proc or you end up on top of him and proc it (then use shroud to escape or set up another Q-wait or Q-AA combo). If he blows it on Q, just wait and try again.
4. Once you have blown everything, RUN. Do not stand there and trade with him, he will beat you. If you have been keeping even, he is going to be very hurt and will either back, or try and stay in lane. The former is as good as kill as you can now make up some farm or roam. The latter, just have patience and wait for your next opportunity to strike.
5. Careful fighting him amongst minions, he will build stacks quick. You need to be ready to run.
6. Shroud isn't always about defense or escape. Sometimes (this is something I don't have a guide for, it's just something I do on the fly) I will W before or after the initial Q to set up a pattern. After one or two full combos on Yas, opponents learn that your shroud means you are going to unload and they should get out of your R range. This is really useful if you want to farm as you can set up your combo, then farm when he distances himself from you. Don't make a habit of this or your opponent will learn to call your bluff (and sometimes you want this, as you bait them to their demise, again, you need to feel the flow of the lane and your opponent).

Pop his shield with an auto attack and then follow up with a damage ability. The damage hurts a lot since he has a really low base health pool. Don't be afraid to fight him 1v1 early since he has bad base stats and really needs items. First item should be a {{item:3191}} . DO NOT push him into tower, he can get every minion with an aa+e, if possible let him push and freeze it infront of your tower. If he blocks an ability with windwall, abuse the long cooldown. Ask your jungler to camp him since if he falls behind, he stays behind. Late game don't fight him unless you can instakill him. Try not to get ~~pregnant~~ knocked up in teamfights if possible . He is annoying but manageable.

I like the idea of this thread.
People should stick to one champion per post, though, it makes it easier to find the information readers might be looking for.

{{champion:53}} Fucking high-reward, no-risk champion. If they land a grab their win chance raises by 3%, I swear. If they have a Blitz in general it's like a guaranteed lane win. If he grabs you then you are fucked and there's nothing you can do about it.

You may say, "Stay behind minions lel" but he can just ult to clear them instantly or use his W to zoom around them like Blitz formula one. 
You may say, "Get Banshee's Veil lel" but unless you're waiting until FULL BUILD like 40-50 minutes in where you've likely surrendered then it'll be too late. If you get it early you're 2750 gold behind the enemy ADC just so that you can survive one grab. 

The speed is massive, the range is massive, and the width is massive so don't say, "Dodge it lel". It has a range of 925 and a speed of 1800 so it'll take about 0.5 seconds to reach you. I have a ping of 100 (if it spikes even a little bit you're fucked) on average so I have 0.4 seconds to react. At an average of 400 movespeed I'll have 160 distance I'll be able to travel if I click immediately after he uses grab. So that gives me like a 0.2 seconds max time to click and dodge it. Average human reaction time is 250 milliseconds so I'm fucked. 

You may say, "What about Thresh lel" but his has a windup of 0.5 seconds, pulls you half the distance, and takes 1.5 seconds to pull you. 

Then Blitz also has a 1 second knockup on a 5 second cooldown. On URF he kept you PERMANENTLY knocked up. Both his Q and E have 100% AP ratios. His ult has a 30 second cooldown for being a massive AOE damage + 0.5 silence and a passive that deals massive damage. 

Fuck you Blitz, I ban you every time.

{{champion:74}} main here-

First thing you want to do as any ranged champion against him is get to lane early. If you get there just as the minions start fighting, chances are he's already got 3 turrets down and is ready to dominate. Get to lane early and harass him super hard. Destroy his turrets. Poke him a bunch. Heimerdinger is EXTREMELY squishy early game, so you can get him really low. Also, play intelligently. Never stop moving around so that he misses his rockets and stuns, and most importantly, **NEVER** chase him through his turrets. You have no idea how many kills I've gotten because someone decided to head right into my turrets and walked right into a stun, or I was ganked and both players decided to head into the turrets.

...which brings me to ganking. There are certain times you should and shouldn't gank Heimerdinger- because trust me, if he has 3 turrets up and all of his abilities ready to go, that's a double kill for him right there. Gank him when he has all of his turrets down and on cooldown and doesn't have his stun or ult up, either. After level 6, he'll probably place down a mega turret during ganks. **In scenarios like this, focus the mega turret.** By around this time, he'll have rushed Zhonya's, and so he'll most likely activate it after placing his mega turret, giving you time to destory it before you kill him.

Also, **DON'T let him get fed.** This tip stands for any champion, but especially Heimerdinger. How viable he is late game depends on how fed he became early game.

So yeah, just do all that. Or you could play {{champion:69}} and be the bane of my existence. Good luck playing against the slew of free-week {{champion:74}} this week!

Also worth adding here that if you get to lane early and he isn't there go check enemy gromp/krugs if top side, and chickens if mid lane. Personally I don't ever start stacking turrets in lane unless I'm top and jg starts that side (bc then I can't take lvl 2 and walk to lane). Heimer takes a jg camp w/ turrets while taking very little dmg from tanking a couple hits, and level advantage can be huge because it sets up a tower dive when you hit level 6 and the enemy is level 5. Also it lets you not push the lane immediately and get level 3 before you start hard pushing, so level 2 ganks aren't a big threat. I find that more heimers do this as you go up in elo bc it's a pretty big advantage, and almost no one checks to see if they're doing this, or tries to stop it.

Also {{champion:8}} is the true bane of his existence, a good one auto beats heimer. His aoe thing clears turrets w/ the wave really fast at 4 stacks, and he can q to heal off the turrets and just out sustain the turret damage. If heimer keeps turrets up vs vlad there's probably a huge skill difference between the two players. Fuck vlad, hate that dude.

I'm relatively inexperienced (Bronze V), and so I've never seen anyone do that before with the exception of Faker. I might start, though. Also, I've never played {{champion:74}} vs.{{champion:8}} , but I fear the day that I do. I've just had the worst experience with Cass so far.

If you haven't  checked them out look up heisendongna and gbktv on twitch. Heisendong is the best heimer on the NA server and phasekiller (one of the people on gbktv) is the best heimer on the kr server. Phasekiller streams in English as well as Korean and usually has smaller viewer count so more interaction with the steamer if you want to ask him questions, but heisendongna is usually really good about answering questions too. Both have past broadcasts to watch if they aren't on when you are free to watch. You can improve a whole bunch looking at what they do and trying to figure out what you don't do. For me auto attack harass and objective control/rotations were big, but the biggest thing I would not have learned on my own ever was diving the tower for a kill at level 6. Turrets don't draw aggro to you until they laser so you can drop ult + one under tower and get damage on them before tanking tower, then stun and rocket gets a kill. Up to about mid silver no one reacts right and you get fisrt blood or an early kill almost every single game.

Sorry for the wall of text hope it was useful. All shall bow down to the power of the donger!

{{champion:11}} main here,  he usually plays really squishy, so unforeseen  **HARD** cc will be the death of him. Yes there's the option of Q dodging but that's skill on his part. If you invade him early, prevent him from getting sated he's not going to hit his powerspikes for a while. 
Item wise are iffy counters as he has ways around them, especially with sated now:

{{item:3075}} make him damage himself. However, any MR he builds, (or gains for being melee), his true damage procs, any lifesteal effects he builds and amplified by sated will get around that but he at least won't be doing as much healing. 

{{item:3143}} more HP, more armor, attack speed slow when he isn't ulted. Honestly, the perfect anti Yi item. 
{{item:3110}} 
If really worried about him then {{item:3047}} could be a sound investment as well.


If you see him use his meditate as an AA reset, and he hasn't gotten a reset yet, abuse it and try to burst him down. Same for if his Q is down. (Just remember his AAs reset the Q timer by 1 sec each). The more glass cannon he builds, the more doomed is if you cc him, the more tanky he builds, the less damage he does. (This might be obvious, but when people think of him they think of insane damage and glass cannon but forcing him to build tank will help.) When he pops ult, if you can prevent him from attacking, then you've just made him nowhere near as good as he could be because his ult doesn't reset when he gets kills (Unlike another certain reset champ who's passive is resetting). 

Fears especially mess with him because while ulted he runs full speed.

For most of the early match up **do not concern yourself with creeps.** Taking a full combo in order to get one creep is not worth it - instead focus on winning trades the LB initiates with Distortion. If you win your trades soon enough LB will have to recall and you can shove the lane and earn back the creeps you lost and if LB does not recall you have lane advantage and she is forced to play safe. 

On your first back buy as many potions as you can - you will need them. If you're playing a mage consider buying {{item:1056}} {{item:1033}} or other MR items to boost your chances of winning trades as you come into level spikes. For instance, {{champion:134}} with 4 potions, {{item:1056}} {{item:1056}} {{item:1033}} will be able to weather LB's trades while returning damage until it gets to the point where LB is forced to recall again or a kill opportunity is presented. 

In this match up the pace is dictated by LB - you will have to respond to her trades and salvage the creeps that you are able to. Her damage can be high but it's only a problem if you are not **actively returning trade damage** and attempting to exploit her playstyle (constant trading). Build for the match up - do not buy items that will only boost your damage and not your defense unless you are 100% confident you can win that way because it is just not sustainable vs. LB.

{{champion:92}} and {{champion:157}} are perhaps the two that annoy me the most. With their high mobility, shields, and incredible damage potential I find it very difficult to ever get a trade in my favor. Ranged harass is often avoided or shielded. And even if I do get them rather low, I still have to give them a  very large buffer zone or risk getting all-inned. I seems as though they must make many mistakes for me to get a kill, yet all they need from me is a single error.
Personally the champs I have issues with are {{champion:1}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:5}} and {{champion:157}}

Well I'm just a silver {{champion:131}} main, but here is my two cents. 
Diana holds a strong power spike when she hits six, and will often buy a damage item instead of a mana item. Being aggressive from a range early will usually cause them to lose cs and fall behind. But one still needs to be wary of her level 6. Her Q travels counter clockwise, and it can be used to farm or poke from a distance. Try to walk counter clockwise if you see it cast or walk directly towards her so it will arc around you.

 After level 6 try to see if you can keep the jungler nearby. Diana will probably go in on you as soon as she sees an opportunity for a kill with her ult. Bait them and have the jungler come in when they do. If Diana does go in on you the best thing you can do is keep calm. If you try to run she'll use her E and proc her passive on you. The best you can do is turn and try to trade or CC her. And keep a close eye on her. She may go bot to snowball and her ability to kill squishies makes her very good at killing ADC's or their valiant support sacrificing themselves. Late game she relies on a strong engage to go in first. Otherwise she'll die right away. She'll most likely dive in on the squishiest person in the fight to kill them. Then use the reset to kill the next priority target. Try to CC her and prevent that from happening. 

I hope this was a bit helpful.
